blocks.name: ballotlemoex
blocks.content: ` O ` is a set. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 7-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm ballotlemoex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, cn)
  -| wcel(c2, cn)
  -| wceq(c0, crab(s0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, cn))
  a1ii(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, cn))
  a1ii(wcel(c0, universe), diffsc(s0, c0))
  rabex2(s0, c0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1))
  pwex(co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2)))
  ovex(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2)))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c1, caddc, c2)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
}

thm ballotlemoex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï
  ‚ä£ c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï
  ‚ä£ c0 = { s0 ‚àà P((1[...](c1[+]c2)))|(# ` s0)= c1 }
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  a1ii(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  a1ii(c0 ‚àà ùïå, d(s0, c0))
  rabex2(s0, c0, P((1[...](c1[+]c2))), (# ` s0)= c1)
  pwex((1[...](c1[+]c2)))
  ovex(nat1, cfz, (c1[+]c2))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, (1[...](c1[+]c2)))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, (c1[+]c2))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)

thm ballotlem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {

  3eqtr2i(cfv(chash, c0), co(co(c1, caddc, c2), cbc, c1), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1))), co(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), cbc, c1))
  fveq2i(chash, c0, crab(s0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1)))

  fzfi(nat1, co(c1, caddc, c2))
  nnzi(c1)
  hashbc(s0, co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2)), c1)
  oveq1i(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), cbc, c1, co(c1, caddc, c2))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c1, caddc, c2))), co(c1, caddc, c2)), wcel(co(c1, caddc, c2), cn0))
  mp2b(wcel(co(c1, caddc, c2), cn0), wa(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wcel(co(c1, caddc, c2), cn))
  pm3.2i(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn))

  diff.co.s(s0, c1, caddc, c2)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

} = {

  bitri(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wss(c0, co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3)))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), c2)))
  elrab2(hs0, c0, c1, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), c2), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2))
  fveqeq2(cv(hs0), c0, chash, c2)
  eqtri(c1, crab(hs0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2)), crab(s0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))
  cbvrabv(s0, hs0, cpw(co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2))
  fveqeq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), chash, c2)

  elpw2(c0, co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3)))

  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), c2))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, co(nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3)))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, co(c2, caddc, c3))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c2, caddc, c3)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, chash, cv(hs0))
  diff.chash.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

thm ballotlem5(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(c1 \ c2)‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà(1[...](c3[+]c4)),((c5 ` c0)` s0)= 0))
  ‚ä£ c3 ‚àà ‚Ñï

  ‚ä£ c6 =(s2 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶((# ` s2)[√∑](# ` c1)))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(s1 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚Ü¶((# `((1[...]s3)‚ãÇ s1))[-](# `((1[...]s3)\ s1)))))
  ‚ä£ c2 = { s1 ‚àà c1 | ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(1[...](c3[+]c4)), 0[<]((c5 ` s1)` s3))}
  ‚ä£ c4[<]c3

  mpbi(0[<](c3[-]c4), c4[<]c3)

blocks.name: ballotlemic
blocks.content: If the first vote is for B, the vote on the first tie is for A. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: ballotlemieq

blocks.name: ballotlem8

blocks.name: ballotth
blocks.content: Bertrand's ballot problem : the probability that A is ahead throughout the counting. The proof formalized here is a proof "by reflection", as opposed to other known proofs "by induction" or "by permutation". This is Metamath 100 proof #30. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 7-Dec-2016.)
